IN BRIEF
The purpose of this paper is to demonstrate that there is need for professional
development of educational broadcasting as an effective and continuing approach to
citizenship training.
A. The Premise
1. The ideas and ideals which characterize American democratic society
face a period of serious crisis and threat in the years ahead.
2. Education is a fundamental tool in the instillation and preservation of
these ideas and ideals»
3. Traditional methods of education are inadequate to meet the stress and
strains of the times.
B. The Answer
1. Educational radio^especially television—provide the most rapid means
for dynamic expansion of the educational facilities and educational effectiveness
of the country.
a. The attained status of educational broadcasting and the projected
expansion in the next few years indicate satisfactory progress of
the technology.
b. There is a widening gap between the technology and the people with
the knowledge, skills, and understandings to apply it to education.
c. Such a personnel resource can only be developed through expanded
activities aimed at creating a true profession of educational broadcasters.
d. The development of a core of highly competent professionals to operate
radio and television facilities has a direct bearing on the effective use
of such facilities in the furtherance of civic education.
e. Educational broadcasting is uniquely qualified to utilizing these
instruments for advancing civic education via programming for children
in school, adults at home, and teachers in service.
C. The Plan
1. In addition to continuing its traditional activities as a professional
association, the NAEB will intensify its efforts to;
a. Develop an increased number of well-prepared and dedicated people
with standards, qualifications, and skills of a true professional group,
thus reinforcing a project to ...
b. Develop a major citizenship training program through facilities and
personnel of educational broadcasting implemented through seminars,
program series, and cooperative enterprise with educational institutions
and associations.
